title: Key Facts
body: We live in a multi-device world. The growth of internet enabled devices such as smartphones, tablets and laptops means that increasingly we have to deliver learning solutions that work on all devices. This is not as simple as a desktop and mobile solution; what is required is a multi-device solution.
instruction: Click the + icons below for more.

_items.title: Introduction
_items.body:
With the advent of modern browsers, frameworks, developments in HTML 5 and responsive design approaches we're now able to create engaging learning that will work, regardless of the device being used.

In addition, Libraries such as Backbone, Underscore and Handlebars have rapidly sped up development and enabled the production of fast single page applications (SPAs) that improve the user experience.

_items.title: What is responsive elearning?
_items.body:
Responsive elearning Design takes its inspiration from Responsive Web Design; an approach to design that ensures a single version of a website (or an elearning course created as a web app) can provide a viewing experience optimised to complement a variety of different devices, from desktop monitor to smartphone.This tailored viewing experience is achieved by:
  • providing dynamic layouts which allow for the resizing of onscreen elements to make the most of the space available (fluid grid concept)
  • automatically detecting the characteristics of the device being used and applying an appropriate style to all onscreen elements (Media queries and CSS)
  • ensuring all images can be scaled to complement the device being used at the time

title: 1、内容的垂直滚动: 关于垂直滚动的再考量
displayTitle: 内容的垂直滚动: 关于垂直滚动的再考量
body: 我列举了以下几点我认为垂直滚动是一种可以很好地呈现课程内容的方法，甚至可以说是一种很可行的呈现方式:
instruction: 请选择下面的标题来显示文本。

_items.alt: 您的学习用户已经习惯使用
_items.title: 您的学习用户已经习惯使用
_items.body: 垂直滚动是最有可能影响一个网站整体设计的元素。用户想知道他们所期望的内容，向下滚动页面，阅读的内容。研究表明，其实，比起传统多模板设计用户更喜欢这种方式。我们想呈现的学习内容，当然我们应该选择一种用户更舒服或者说是更习惯的方式。

_items.alt: 各种设备证明滚动方式很有效的
_items.title: 各种设备证明滚动方式很有效的
_items.body: More and more learners are accessing content on a wide range of devices and each of these devices will display pages differently. The only thing you can guarantee is if you’re accessing content on a smartphone vertical scrolling will be required. Why not embrace this and place responsive design and vertical scrolling at the heart of your design?

_items.alt: 有意义的页面及信息导航
_items.title: 有意义的页面及信息导航
_items.body: It's common sense to cluster any related content on a single page that’s either as short or as long as it needs to be.  Not only does this reduce any unnecessary navigation, it also helps the learner make sense of the structure and the relationship between content. Navigation becomes meaningful, rather than a by-product of the template size.

_items.alt: ‘Everything above the fold（不用滚动就可以看到的领域）’ 可能是旧帽子，但是...
_items.title: ‘Everything above the fold（不用滚动就可以看到的领域）’ 可能是旧帽子，但是...
_items.body: ...The principle remains. Due to the variety of devices used to access web content you’ll only be able to guarantee the first 400 or 500 pixels of a page will be visible, so there’s no harm in putting the important stuff first and hooking your learners early. In fact, we advocate this as good practice, regardless of what page layouts are being used.

_items.title: 更多灵活性
_items.body: Scrolling pages still allow you to present content via interactive elements (we call them components instead of templates), but with a scrolling page there is far more flexibility in how these elements are presented. Layouts can now vary in size and the density of content, which in turn creates more space for branding to be incorporated. Or indeed some precious white space to give the content space to breathe.  Overruns are also a thing of the past meaning localisation of content becomes a simpler proposition as well.

_items.alt: 不要把婴儿与洗澡水一起倒掉（意思是把很多东西混淆在一起可能会失去重要的东西）
_items.title: 不要把婴儿与洗澡水一起倒掉（意思是把很多东西混淆在一起可能会失去重要的东西）
_items.body: None of the above means we stop following instructional design best practice.  We continue to put the learner at the heart of what we produce, writing well-structured which follows an appropriate learning model. It’s more about looking around at what is going on within the wider web community and taking note of changes in best practice and the nature of how content, is being accessed.

title: 垂直滚动的主要优点
body: 你能找出几个垂直滚动方法提供了比传统的'上一步'和'下一步'做法的好处吗？?
instruction: 选择一个或多个并点击提交。

_items.text: Vertical scrolling as a means of navigation on the web is common place and therefore familiar to users
Placing scrolling at the heart of your approach means designs are more mobile friendly
It reduces the need for unnecessary navigation as pages can be as long as they need to be
It means that you no longer need to first gain your learners' attention

_feedback.correct:
That’s correct. Your users are almost certainly using vertical scrolling whenever they interact with the web so why reinvent the wheel? Scrolling is also a given when viewing content on a smartphone so any page which is structured with this in mind will help make the design and its navigation feel well thought through for mobile. Clustering related content within a single page should definitely reduce the need to navigate to a different page, as well as that repetitive ‘Click next to continue’ instruction as well.

Of course, we should always try to gain the learners attention early on the page, it’s just that now, when we have it, we aren’t asking them to go somewhere else. The design challenge is now to give them a reason to scroll and venture down ‘below the fold’. To continue close this tutor pop-up.

title: What’s coming next?
body: Find out what’s on the roadmap for 2014 for Adapt Learning.

_items.title: Improvements
_items.body: Over the next few months we’ll be working on a number of developments to improve Adapt Learning to ensure it’s the leading elearning framework for responsive content. At the heart of these developments are two key pieces of work.

_items.title: 1: Plug-in Friendly Architecture
_items.body: We’re in the process of reworking the codebase to ensure a plugin friendly approach. This will help us to establish an extensive and vibrant open source community to support the framework and adhere to the principles of collaborative development.

_items.title: 2: Authoring Tool
_items.body: We’re also creating an authoring tool to allow non-technical users to create fully featured Adapt elearning courses. The authoring tool will be simple enough for novices to use yet powerful enough to meet the needs of the elearning professional.

_items.title: Missing title and body elements
_items.body: As mentioned before, title and body elements on components are not compulsory. The same is true for articles and blocks.

_items.title: Use space
_items.body: One important learning pattern to remember is to not fill every component. This can lead to a poor user experience on smaller screens. We're use to scrolling on smaller devices so use up the vertical space.

_items.alt: Think about background images for decoration
_items.title: Think about background images for decoration
_items.body: One way of bringing content to life is adding background images to blocks or articles. We suggest doing this after the content is produced so the imagery can aid the learning.

_items.title: Single components
_items.body: Single components are interactions that enable two components in a block. These take up half of a blocks width.

_items.title: Spanned components
_items.body: Spanned components are interactions that take up a full block and do not allow another component to sit next to it.

_items.title: Single and Spanned components
_items.body: Some components are both single and spanned. This means they can sit with another component or fill a whole block. Some exmaples are: Graphic, Text and Media
